data.body: ... box collision for a shape in the Shape Editor. I am not sure if this is the proper fix because because I would think the list would shrink from 3 to 2 instead of just setting the last element to NULL. Didn't spend a lot of time with this to find out what the larger problem was.

data.title: Add a new keybind to profile for exactly two seconds
data.body: This might be helpful if you want to compare profiles over the same length of time, instead of relying on holding down the profile key combo for an approximate length of time.

```
schedule(2000, 0, function(%a) { echo(%a); }, horses);
```

data.title: OpenGL debug crash on Intel HD4000

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
Started a project from the development branch using the project generator (with #1081), compiled, switched to OpenGL using settings dialog, restarted the game, loaded the level, and got an access violation crash [here](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/gfx/gl/gfxGLShader.cpp#L464).

```
glGetProgramiv( mProgram, GL_LINK_STATUS, &linkStatus );
```

[console.log](http://hastebin.com/oreneresiv.txt)

Notice the VRAM is reported as 0, whereas with D3D it's reported correctly as 1746MB.

data.body: Replaces part of #1078. Instead of doing manual reference counting, we use a `StrongRefPtr` in this method.

data.title: Reflection in the water does NOT show LevelInfo fog
data.body:
![screenshot_002-00000](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2813538/5554786/3bd711c6-8c43-11e4-85d4-91b3a7c19d6c.png)

the water reflection shows the scattersky WITHOUT the levelinfo fog. 
To test this, put up water and scattersky. watch the water. NOW, add levelinfo fog. the reflection wont change.

data.title: GUI editor messes up water(?) rendering
data.body:
Before:

![gui editor closed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/904269/5517966/aeeec64a-895f-11e4-8ca3-4f7323f97ab7.png)

After:

![gui editor open](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/904269/5517965/aeedd190-895f-11e4-81da-ae99260771b1.png)

Scrolling the GUI editor results in the water level appearing to shift vertically in the scene. It's very odd. And you can see that decal roads appear to have a similar issue.
